attributes.action: A full parliamentary investigation into the conduct of the CSA/CMS
attributes.background:
The CSA (now the CMS) is not fit for purpose. Their rules are outdated. Their calculations are arbitrary and their staff are rude.

Child support is a vital part of many people's lives and this should be taken care of by a competent organisation.

rejection.details:
If you would like Parliament to establish a parliamentary commission to look into this issue, you could start a new petition asking for that. Alternatively, if you would like the House of Commons to refer this matter to an existing committee - most obviously the Work and Pensions Committee, which scrutinises the work of the Department for Work and Pensions - you could start a new petition asking for that. 

You'll need to give your full name to start a petition. We can only accept petitions from named individuals, not organisations.
